the bile is stored in the gallbladder

we've gone from the mouth down the

into the small intestine and then the
next section would be going through the
large intestine the large intestine is
also called the colon and it's
approximately 1.5 meters long and 6.5
centimeters in diameter all of the
indigestion material the stuff that's
not absorbed into the bloodstream and
into the body cells enters the large
intestines one of the major processes
that happen in the large intestines is
that water is being absorbed and as
waters absorb this is leaving behind
more solid material also there are some
anaerobic bacteria in the large
intestine that synthesizes vitamins B
and K and those are absorbed into the
body as needed the remaining in
digestibility really call it feces and
that reaches a rectum after
approximately 18 to 24 hours in the
large intestine and then it's eliminated
through the anus
when you use the restroom your meals
entire journey takes 24 to 33 hours it
takes 2 to 4 hours in the stomach 3 to 5
hours in the small intestines and then
18 to 24 hours in the large intestine so
in review we've looked at the functions
of the digestive system and then we took
a journey through the digestive tract
following the food from the mouth to the
esophagus to the stomach to the small
intestine to the large intestine and out
the anus we looked at the processes of
ingestion digestion absorption and
elimination and that is the end of
section 35 point 1
